PIPE Estimator Class

Source: R/PIPEConstructor.R
PipeEstimator-class.Rd

Initialize a new PipeEstimator object

Update the PIPE estimator with posterior probabilities

Update the weight parameter

Set the epsilon parameter

Set the target epsilon parameter

Update epsilon using the specified tapering method

Generate a visualization of the dose configurations

Arguments

validConfigs

List of valid dose configurations

epsilonTarget

Target epsilon value after tapering

taper_type

Type of tapering function ('linear', 'quadratic', or NULL)

custom_taper

Custom tapering function (or NULL)

weightNew

New weight value

epsilonNew

New target epsilon value

n_total

Total sample size

n_current

Current sample size

p_posterior

Vector of posterior probabilities

Value

List of log gain values for each valid configuration

Updated epsilon value

A ggplot object

Details

A reference class that implements the Product of Independent Beta Probabilities Escalation (PIPE) design with epsilon-tapering for dose-finding studies. This class calculates posterior gain functions and determines the optimal dose configuration based on the PIPE methodology.

Fields

validConfigs

List of valid dose configurations

bestConfigs

The optimal dose configuration (DoseConfiguration object)

validConfigs_posterior

List of posterior estimates for all valid configurations

epsilon

Numeric value representing the mixing rate parameter

epsilonTarget

Numeric target epsilon value after tapering

weight

Numeric parameter set for each dose level

taper_type

Character string specifying the tapering function type

custom_taper

Custom tapering function (or NULL)

See also

DrugCombination-class for the drug combination class
